title: Far better than kempty fall
review: I love travel and explore the new thing and I really love this place. It is not that much famous and popular as kempty fall, that is why it is still far better than kempty fall. Quit peaceful, beautyful and untouched. I love to be here but it is better to come here in summer.

title: Lovely Quiet Peaceful In Touch with Nature
review: What a pretty waterfall - and clean.  And no tourists.  bu more importanly what a lovely trek through the mountains to get there.  Most of it is paved but enough rugged walks available in the area.  Very few people visit to its still unspoilt.  No garbage or plastic bags lying around

title: How can tourists be so callous?
review: A beautiful piece of nature, cool and inviting waters. Isolated, not crowded. BUT, tourists who have gone their before have left a lot of litter all over the place. How can tourists be so callous?

title: Beautiful Experience At Jharipani Fall
review: Not Suitable for Old age & weak heart People because 2 kilometers difficult trekking is required to reach the place, very peaceful place with natural beauty at its best. Take enough drinking water with you as no vendors are there on the way. young & People loves trekking will like this place

title: Purely natural
review: Pros:

title: Beautiful
review: Falls have been an inpiration for many poets and this one is really awesome with its clean and continuously flowing milky water

title: A bad experience
review: We have reached to the approach road after lot of efforts through traffic jam. There were no proper direction towards this fall. Found there is practically no road to reach this fall, only a walking road through jungle. Look like abandoned place, with no  person around. Got scared to walk 2 KMs through jungle with ladies and returned back without reaching the spot. Very disappointed.

title: Nice Falls
review: This is a pure natural waterfall on the Dehradun-Mussoorie Road. It is a good place to stop and take in some natural beauty.

title: Wonderful
review: Jharipani waterfall is a good half hour walk from the nearest motorable road. The road is in very bad condition, and the ground seems to be giving way at points, so it is not be terribly safe. It was a nice climb back to the road from the waterfall, and we managed to take photos of a Khaleej Pheasant on the way. From the calls that I heard, I believe it would be a good place for a bit of bird-watching.

title: Wonderful place
review: This place is really nice to spend some good time in pure natural environment. The place has good roads as well

title: Nice trek and waterfall
review: The trek starts at a very unknown point. There is just one billboard to show where it starts. You will think  you are going nowhere for a long time. The trek is long and strenous. But the falls are very nice when you reach. This place is not very crowded.

title: Secluded waterfalls
review: Jharipani waterfalls is a less explored attraction in the Mussoorie hills.

title: not crowed
review: only for those who loves trekking.it is not a great waterfall but view of hills from here was amazing. if you have spare 2 hours you can visit

title: A steep Hike
review: Not really much of a Waterfall but if you are adventureous enough and have an hour to kill then it's worth the hike. Early morning would be the best time.

title: not great
review: it is not a good waterfall but not much crowed as kempty fall. good for trekking lovers. you can take some photos with nature but for me waste of time

title: Trekking
review: If you are fond of trekking you will like visiting this spot.  it is with very less crowd and awesome place.

title: Adventurous
review: Very tough trekking but amazing experience... almost no crowd... only for youngsters... children and old people cant go

title: The Beauty
review: This fall is one of the beautiful places,ideal for picnic,nature lovers and adventure enthusiasts.The surroundings of the fall are adorned with various species of wild flowers,creepers,shrubs and plants,which grow on the mountains rocks on its sides.

title: Hidden Jewel
review: It is in the sort of forest in Mussoorie. Approx. 5 kilometer away from main mall road. You need to trek down to reach this place.

title: Good falls!!!
review: When we went to this falls there is no that much of water flow.  But the place was good and climate is too cold.

title: Small Waterfall
review: The trek to the waterfall is about 2 Kms from the motorable road. The trek itself is quite scenic and quiet(not so popular with travellers). We visited the place in October - our only problem was that the track was quite slippery at places.

title: Fine Waterfall in the wilderness so close to Mussoorie
review: Jharipani Waterfall is just a few kms before Mussoorie when travelling from Dehradun. It can be reached after a trek of a couple of kilometres.  The path is well made but is located away from any human habitation. Couple of hours could be spent here when you are in Mussoorie.

title: Ok ok
review: It was very far from the mall but it was not as worth visit it was just a fall a simple thing of nature

title: Not worth the effort
review: The falls is not connected by a motorable road. The path that leads to the fall is not maintained well. It is a lonely stretch downhill of about 4 kms. Try only if you are ready to trek and are in a group. It would be good to have a local with you.

title: Difficult to reach
review: Roadway to reach this is completely gone bad due to rains. The path is slippery and passes through jungle. Got to walk a long way and better go along with someone who knows this place. You can skip this place if you dont have much time in your itinerary.

title: Great trekking!!!
review: We had gone to Jharipani waterfall in a group and really enjoyed the trekking route of almost 2kms the waterfall is really very awesome as it is  secluded and all surrounded by beautiful  natural flora and fauna .....As it was very cold and water was freezing so couldn't dare to get inside but I am sure in summers it must be very exciting.

title: Nice Place for picnic on weekend
review: If you are not able to reach Mussoorie on weekend. it can be a very nice place to enjoy.

title: Great Experience
review: What a beautiful site..... loved the nature and waterfall.... excellent place to relax ...I was staying at Jharipani Castle Resort and they recommend me to visit this place for trekking...

title: Calm place lost in Mussoriee
review: Offbeat place in laps of Mussoriee hills. You can enjoy a small trek in serene environment away from the hustle of Mussoriee. Enjoy the cold and pure water of this fall. The place is a must visit I loved it more than Kempty fall where water is dirty and you will find thousands of people.

title: An offbeat falls
review: Take a trek up to this place which is away from the hubbub of Mussourie. This is quiet and you can contemplate yourself enjoying the cold and the crystal water of the falls.

title: So so
review: This place may be the last place you should keep in your iteneray. It just one of those places which becomes popular to attract shoppers

title: Trek to Jharipani falls
review: A visit to Jharipani falls makes for a wonderful trekking experience.

title: The beauty of nature
review: A must visit place for the one who loves to explore nature. It's the perfect place if you are in a mood to refresh yourself in a calm and serene place. It offers you with an amazing view at every step. There is a beautiful waterfall with trees around. If you love nature you would love this place too!

title: Famous picnic spot
review: Place gives beautiful views of the Shivalik ranges. Surrounding of fall has lush greenery. Good place for kids

title: Nice falls
review: I would recommend this one over kempty falls as it is cleaner and much less crowded. Intersting place.

title: Better
review: Much better place than Kempty falls ,though not big but less crowded and not so commercial . good place to visit

title: It's an awesome natural place ..in mid of Jungle
review: If you truly want a rejunvation and a nice jungle track; this place is worth visit. Away from hassle of Musoorie town and it has a trekking of almost two KMs from the motor able road..so lazy fellows, plz avoid

title: yes can visit
review: Its a decent place to visit, but can scip if you have visited kempty falls. good place there is a small restaurant, the tea is good over there

title: Wooooooooow way....
review: You have to take a left side cut from Mussoorie Road to enter the way to Jharipani falls. The falls is just like others, but one should enjoy the ride from that cut till Jharipani falls.

title: Just Avoid. Waste of time.
review: I don't know why they have made this as a tourist location. It is a small stream of water. If you have ever visited banglore/pune, then you can see waterfalls like this on outskirts easily.

title: Offbeat - quite and nice
review: This place is almost at the end of dehradun road and close to road where mussorrie starts, its on the left side of the dehradun mussorie road and you have to ride around 10 minutes inside. This place is quite decent, preferably enjoyable in rainy seasons only, its like water stream between two rocks and little stream of water if you walk through around 200 meters inside it. Normal water level is till knees..Can give a try to this place

title: Nature-Views
review: A place close to natue

title: Crowded place
review: Very little water, when we visited. Lot of crowd. Didn't like much. Too many tourist buses stopping, and filled with people.

title: Offbeat and Adventurous
review: This is basically an offbeat trekking place which can be done by youngsters, not recommended for children and elderly people. very serene and peaceful in the lap of hills. the trekking is quite dangerous as well as doesn't have any proper roads. But it is a heaven for people who like adventure.

title: Average place
review: very average place. Mussorrie has many good scenic points like company garden and lal tibba to be visited

title: Very nice stay with sterling memorable trip"
review: Very nice and nice view we enjoy very much and weather is so cool i think  jharipani falls excellent and i feel so comfortable

title: small water fall
review: Jharipani is about 7 kilometer from musoorie .it is a secluded place a beautiful scienery.one has to go by car only .

title: View wise it's good place
review: I was there to searching for my brother in laws boarding school,I found out this place is fantastic place,good view points and good sunset point.one small water fall is there which can explore.Overall it's nice place.You can see total Dehradun city in aerial view.

title: Great jungle walk
review: Post monsoon, the falls are always a great place to visit. I wish someone would sponsor an incinerator so that dry waste can be burnt there.

title: It’s so beautiful in rainy seasons
review: Very nice and nice view we enjoy very much and weather is so cool falls excellent and I feel so comfortable, trekking place, enjoyable in rainy seasons only, it’s so beautiful. Wonderful if you need quiet alone time

title: Avoid this place
review: From the road the distance to Jharipani fall is about 1 km and you need to walk on steep road and mud. I guess this place is closed since 2009. Please visit this place only if you like mountaineering and are an expert or you are bachelor who can take pain in climbing over big stones. The road is broken and surrounded with fallen trees and stones. Please be cautious as at 1-2 places it's really dangerous. This is very very remote area near to a school. I was with my wife and 22 months old daughter we had terrible time walking on damaged roads. Finally I managed to go alone and took a few pictures and made a small video.The water fall still exists and you can hear clear sound of it but how to reach is waterfall a very very tough task. People in family or couple please avoid it.

title: Peaceful and silent place.... Don't miss
review: This place is trekking spot, you need to go down around 2-3 km, you rarely find people there. Place is quite silent and peaceful. you will not get anything to eat there, this is kind of forest.

title: Nice place
review: It's a nice waterfall area with lot of natural beauty around. Enjoyed the pure water of the falls though the stream was slow in this summer weather. Must be good in monsoon time. Nice place.

title: A steep walk down to the stream
review: Although recently paved most of the wave, it is typically not maintained. In one place the paving wraps around 5 small trees that would stop a car getting through. The falls are lovely, in a little amphitheater-like spot, but the last few meters involve some serious scrambling. As is the case all over Mussoorie, the litter ruins the pristine feel of a lovely spot.

title: good
review: this is one of this good , peaceful and worth visiting place in mussoorie. i would recommend this place for one time.

title: A gem in the forest
review: Its got a relatively difficult hike to get to it and theres going to be leeches once you get into the water but its otherwise breathtakingly beautiful. in the middle of the jungle it offers a serene getaway from the usual crowds of Mussorie.

title: Off way
review: Nice view but better only during rainfalls. is not on main way so you ave to go specially to visit it

title: nice place
review: place was nice but you have to walk so much to reach at that place, so prepare yourself for visiting that place

title: A trek deep down the hills
review: This is so so amazing. Since you can't drive here, you should be walking / rather trekking. In monsoons, its so beautiful. wonderful if you need quiet alone time.

title: Pristine gift
review: Most of us just look for an easy sight seeing places or attraction. But here is one a off beat water fall. Not much visited by many people as one have to walk or trek about a kilometre. During my visit it was bit rainy. Which increased the volume of fall. Instead of khempty fall this jharipani is worth visiting.

title: Visit only if you want a trek or jungle walk
review: Ask any local and you will be told that Jharipani is nothing but a village. But if you are ready to stretch your muscles then walk for 2-3 km inside the forest area to visit the waterfall. It is good only because it is in the middle of a inhabited area otherwise the same kind of falls are easily seen on the main roads of these hill while visiting in monsoon season.

title: A Small But Good Water Fall
review: Jharipani Falls is situated 8.5 KM from Mussoorie..Jharipani is well accessible by motorable roads...After 1.5 KM trek the Jharipani Falls commences...

title: Best place at Mussoorie unknown to people
review: if u wanna make ur life experience of musoorie than u must go to the jhari paani waterfall

title: beutiful
review: its worth looking at for the views, its beautiful

title: Jharipani Falls
review: You can avoid this place if you have visited Kempty Falls.  Not worth visiting.  You may feel that you are visiting Kempty falls again.

title: most dificult place
review: while back journey to  we haridwar, we decided to visit jharipani falls. however it is not a famous fall. in way so many people whom we asked for the fall, they alert us and advised not to visit but ignoring them we proceed but at turn to fall, a couple who was standing at their farm house asked us that car can not go further and  walk way is also very risky. they firmly advised not to go further so we returned. however we did not see any other tourist on way. it is not advisable to go to this fall according to my opinion.

title: Excellent place
review: Friends if you are really adventrous and fun loving. This place is for you. This place is not motorable and followed by a track of 2 km into deep dense forest and finally the fall is seen. To touch the fall you have to walk over a tree log of about 5 mtr. long which has be crossed over. This place is best for nature lovers as you won't find any crowd over here that's the best part and believe me its very safesafe too. Since the villagers near to this place are very helpful and clear. But if u are really adventrous then only visit this place bcoz a leopard has also been seen this month nov who has targetted a village women. So follow in a group not alone. For any other advice feel free to contact me on vaibhav.drdo@gmail.com

title: prestine
review: i trekked to jharipani falls 7 years back and it was about a 2 km trek, very narrow, scary uphill and down hill. but when we reaches the falls it was so beautiful and prestine. the fact that man had not done anything commercial there was the beauty. maybe because it was not easy to get there. last year i saw a road leading to the falls and i knew the prestine falls was no longer going to be the same as will soon be a tourist spot..

title: We almost missed it!
review: We had seen reviews about this place on Trip Advisor. We did not like Kempty Falls at all, so wanted to visit these falls. On the way back from Kanatal to Dehradun, we requested the cab driver to take us there. Instead he took us to Musssourie Lake - very ordinary. We insisted that this is not where we wanted to go, but he insisted that there was nothing to see in the Falls. Somehow we convinced him to take us there. We could hear the water from far, but it came upon us suddenly - unspoiled. There were just a few youngsters there and a couple sitting on a rock. Up above, we spotted an eating joint. The water rushing down in a foam was well worth the visit. We took several pictures, and I would recommend all nature lovers to visit this place.

title: remote place but very good compared to kempty falls
review: this is a remote place, jharipani comes before mussoorie, there is a railways residential school near by. the place is worth visiting.

title: Peaceful.
review: It is a less known spot, but the small trek and lack of human interference makes it a very enjoyable spot. If you like to eat and litter places then dont go there. Go to Kempty fall then

title: nature walk
review: if you like some trek...this is aloof, midst of dense forests. Do remember to come back before evening and yes beware of leeks while sitting in water

title: Fall for Lovers _ Jharipani Falls
review: JhariPani Falls is just awesum, if you want to spend time at a lonely fall. You walk in  a forest for about 2 and a half KM and then you reach JhariPani Falls. Frankly on your will find just two to 3 local residents and no one else. Sometimes you will hear some kind of noise, probably it is of some kind of insects there, but its loud. There you can spend some Quality time with your loved one , take bath in Natural pond and relax. There will be no one to disturb you. But make sure you come back before evening . Also it will take at least one hour or more for you to come back to the road. So make sure you plan accordingly. And dont indulge yourself in drinking there. It could be dangerous for you.

title: jharipani falls a wonder in mussoorie
review: a nature has its own fun.a beautiful small water fall in the center of the nature it is situated in barlowganj.a lovely landscape of doon valley and mussoorie.

title: Trekker's Delight.
review: In a lesser known corner of Mussoorie, Jharipani falls is an absolute must for any trekking enthusiast. Situated around 3 kms from Barlowganj, this site is a series of small natural falls where anyone who wants to get away from the daily hustle bustle would find peace and serenity.

title: really jharipani falls...
review: it was a lovely place ...cloudy ..windy...n peaceful place..to much crowed was there..every one was enjoying a lot ..there with there family..our team was also enjoying a lot there.....i would say just wow..wow...wow...n wow..
